title: Bryan and Sara’s Story
text:
Bryan and Sara met back in November 2017 through OkCupid. Sara picked up Bryan on the side of the road on their way to Crissy Field and Fort Point for their first date in San Francisco. This was the first of many walks, dates, and hikes in the first 6 years of a lifetime together.

San Francisco Bay Area, Japan Town



Monroe Michigan, Lake Erie



Colorado, Beckenridge



Japan, Kyoto and Tokyo




California, Monterey



Hawaii, Big Island
Now, we’d like you to join us as we celebrate our marriage with a casual get-together in Hawaii, a place we enjoyed as a couple in early 2023.


Please RSVP by January 1, 2024.

title: Ceremony & Reception
text:
Sunday April 21st, 2024
Time: late afternoon, details TBD

title: Where to Stay
text: We contacted a few hotels about room blocks, but none of them provided competitive discounts. Since the rate for hotels has a wide range on big island, we decided not to reserve a room block so our guests could feel free to choose where to stay. There are a variety of lodging options close to the venue. Our price information below is as of October 2023, before taxes and fees.

title: What Else to Do
text: If you are planning to explore around big island before or after the wedding, here are some links that could be useful. We have done some of the activities below ourselves, but some of the links are just the highly rated options from Google search.

title: Ceremony & Reception
text:
Where
Papa Kona Restaurant & Bar
Address: The Waterfront Row, 75-5770 Ali’i Dr 1st Floor, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740
Ceremony: The lawn out back at Papa Kona
Reception: Cocktail hour followed by dinner on the 2nd floor lanai
Attire: Casual. E.g. Aloha (Hawaiian) shirts and sundresses

title: Ceremony & Reception

Car Rental

Discount Hawaii Car Rental

title: What Else to Do
text:
Things to Do

Volcanoes National Park
Snorkeling

Kikaua Point Park (kid-friendly), we checked this out ourselves and we love it.

Kealakekua Bay (by boat), tour options on Tripadvisor
Night Snorkel with Manta Rays, please Google for more options, there are so many

Beaches

Laʻaloa / White Sands Beach
Maniniowali Beach
Hapuna Beach, entrance fee $5 per person and parking fee $10 per car
Spencer Beach Park (kid-friendly)

Coffee farm tours

Greenwell Farms tour, free guided tour
Heavenly Hawaiian Farms tour


If you are looking for a comprehensive big island guide, we found a lot of great information on The Hawaii Vacation Guide. Have fun!

title: Where to Stay
section: Within walking distance of our wedding venue:
text:
Within walking distance of our wedding venue:

Royal Kona Resort
Address: 75-5852 Ali’i Dr, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

We think this one is the best value for what it is. Standard room rates started at $239/night.

Courtyard by Marriott King Kamehameha’s Kona Beach Hotel

Address: 75-5660 Palani Rd, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

This hotel is more expensive, with rates around $400/night. They do have a little beach and it’s also a Marriott property if you have points with the brand.

title: Where to Stay
text:
10-15 minute drive from the venue:

Kanaloa at Kona by Outrigger

Address: 78-261 Manukai St, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Waterfront condos. They have full kitchens. $269/night for a 2 bed/2 bath


Outrigger Kona Resort & Spa

Address: 78-128 Ehukai St, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Room rates are around $300 - $400. They have a nice pool.
If you prefer to have a full kitchen during your stay, we also recommend looking into airbnb or vrbo.

10-15 minute drive away:

Address: 78-261 Manukai St, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Waterfront condos. They have full kitchens. $269/night for a 2 bed/2 bath

If you prefer to have a full kitchen during your stay, we also recommend looking into airbnb or vrbo. Please don’t hesitate to reach out to us if you have any questions.
